result.execSummary:
The defendant John A. Worden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John A. Worden

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
15CM6 & 15CM8 Cases called @ 1:08 p.m. Defendant John A. Worden in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CM6 -  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant wishes to have counsel but does not qualify for SPD services. DE cannot afford counsel at this time. Defendant will speak with ADA Anderson regarding possible resolution. Recess for the parties to talk. 

Case re-called @ 1:28 p.m. The parties have reached an agreement.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: 15CM6 - NC. 15CM8: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 15CM8: Ct 2 - Dismissed outright. Ct 3 - DRI. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Statement by DE. Court orders: 15CM6 - Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. 15CM8 - 37 days WCJ - Huber, GT, 1 day CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - Conditions: 5 days WCJ - Huber, GT, 1 day CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than March 15, 2015, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, $350 fine plus costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, 15 mo DL rev/ 15 mo IID, OWI Assessment. Appeal rights given.
Status conference on February 5, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Initial apperance on February 2, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

citations.chargeDescr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
